medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Four months prior, the patient experienced episodes of vertigo several times a week lasting up to several hours, associated with nausea and vomiting. Over three months, she had episodes of vertigo with tinnitus, diminished hearing, a sense of fullness in the right ear, and difficulty walking.  Two weeks prior to admission, she awoke with right-sided facial weakness and three days before admission experienced another episode of dizziness. On admission day, she was found unresponsive with shaking extremities and drooling, lasting approximately 5 minutes.
medical_history.past_medical_history: History of febrile seizure in childhood. Six years prior, traumatic fracture of the left hip followed by total hip replacement due to osteonecrosis. Tonsillectomy, cone biopsy of the cervix, cesarean sections. Amenorrhea developed 18 months earlier.
medical_history.social_history: Single, lives with three children, works in sales. Daily alcohol consumption, smokes cigarettes, no illicit drug use. Possible allergies to codeine and penicillin.
